page.title: 20MEMORIES
page.content: Mrs.Turner has lived in Hepworth for 35 years.The village has grown to be like two villages.Important events have been the Co-op centenary in 1947 and the school centenary in 1984.Until 1982 only occasional buses went to Huddersfield,now there are minibuses to Holmfirth.Leaving Hepworth school at 14 Mrs.Turner worked as a clerk in the village Co-op which had a grocery, butchery and drapery department, earning less than many millworkers.A one week summer holiday was usually spent at Bridlington or Scarborough travelling by coach or train from Holmfirth. There were a few other occasional days holiday during the year.House work is now easier and cleaner than in the past with the introduction of electrical devices.The Co-op closed in 1967 becoming a hairdressers and flats.
